author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
S. M. Muthu, a Tamil scholar, who paved the way for the translation of Thirukkural and other Tamil literary works into Japanese language through his pen-friend, passed away at his home town Omalur near here on Tuesday.

He was 96. Mr. Muthu, had completed his intermediate from St. Joseph’s College, Tiruchi. He became a pen-friend of Japanese scholar Shuzo Matsunaga in 1980. Shuzo who had read a few lines on Thirukkural evinced keen interest in translating it into Japanese. Shuzo wrote to Muthuwho sent G. U. Pope’s English translation of the text to him . Mr. Shuzo soon translated Thirukural into Japanese. Thanks to his initiative, Mr. Shuzo attended the fifth World Tamil conference in Madurai.

Mr. Muthu is survived by three sons and three daughters.
title: Tamil scholar passes away
